intro: Angelonia chiquitensis, commonly known as the Chiquitania angelonia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and northern Argentina. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant flowers in shades of red, pink, and purple, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and long-lasting blooms.
